Feature:
General bus error
(common features)
Feature Description: The OBI spec defines a bus error signal (err) that incidates the returning rdata field is invalid.
Verification Goal: Shall be specified in separate OBI verification plan

Feature: Instruction bus error ignored for non-executed instruction
Feature Description: A bus error on an instruction that does not get executed is ignored
Verification Goal: Verify that a bus error is ignored in this case

Feature:
Instruction bus error shall cause a precise exception.

Note that all sub features can be verified in a single test case
Feature Description: Bus error shall cause a switch to machine mode
Verification Goal: Verify that a bus error results in a machine mode exception

Feature:
Instruction bus error shall cause a precise exception.

Note that all sub features can be verified in a single test case
Feature Description: Bus error shall cause a jump to mtvec_addr_i
Verification Goal: Verify correct execution address

Feature:
Instruction bus error shall cause a precise exception.

Note that all sub features can be verified in a single test case
Feature Description: The instruction address related to the bus error shall be stored in mepc, mtval CSR
Verification Goal: Verify mepc, mtval value

Feature:
Instruction bus error shall cause a precise exception.

Note that all sub features can be verified in a single test case
Feature Description: mcause shall be set to the value given in the mcause table in the CV32E40X User Manual
Verification Goal: Verify mcause value

Feature:
Instruction bus error shall cause a precise exception.

Note that all sub features can be verified in a single test case
Feature Description: cover point of feature
Verification Goal: Instruction group vs bus error cover point

Feature: Instruction bus error with ZCE Table jump
Sub Feature: ZCE tablejump proposal specifies exception handling
Feature Description: mepc is set to pc of the C.TBLJ*, and mtval is set to the address in the jump table entry
Verification Goal: verify correct operation for bus error with zce table jump

Feature: Misaligned instructions
Feature Description: A bus error shall apply to any instruction that is fully or partially contained in the faulting bus data field
Verification Goal:
Verify that an instruction that is only partially contained in a faulty bus transaction causes an exception

Specific checks required:
Error on word aligned 32-bit instruction.
Error on lower half of non-word aligned 32-bit instruction.
Error on upper half of non-word aligned 32-bit instruction.

Feature: Misaligned instructions
Feature Description: A bus error shall apply to any instruction that is fully or partially contained in the faulting bus data field
Verification Goal:
Verify that a compressed instruction that shares the bus transaction with another instruction causes an exception

Specific checks required:
Sequential execution with word aligned 16-bit instruction.
Sequential execution with non-word aligned 16-bit instruction.
Word aligned 16-bit instruction reached via jump.
Non-word aligned 16-bit instruction reached via jump.

Feature: Debug interaction of instruction bus error
Sub Feature: Instruction bus error while in debug
Feature Description: A bus error shall appear according to debug spec when in debug mode.
Verification Goal:
Verify a bus error in debug mode
Verify no registers are updated by the exception

Feature: Debug interaction of instruction bus error
Sub Feature: Instruction bus error while single stepping
Feature Description: A bus error shall appear according to debug spec when in single step mode
Verification Goal:
Verify a bus error in single step mode
Verify that debug is reentered immediately after updating pc, tval and cause

Feature: Data bus error shall cause an imprecise non-maskable interrupt(NMI)
Feature Description: A data bus error shall cause an imprecise interrupt that is not masked when single stepping
Verification Goal: Verify that the interrupt is present when single stepping

Feature: Data bus error shall cause an imprecise non-maskable interrupt(NMI)
Feature Description: An interrupt caused by a data bus error shall be masked when in debug mode
Verification Goal: Verify that the interrupt is masked when in debug mode

Feature: Data bus error shall cause an imprecise non-maskable interrupt(NMI)
Feature Description: An interrupt caused by a data bus error shall be masked when in debug mode
Verification Goal: Verify value of nmip bit of dcsr

Feature:
Data bus error shall cause a NMI.

Note that all sub features can be verified in a single test case
Feature Description: Bus error shall cause a switch to machine mode
Verification Goal:
Verify that a bus error results in a machine mode exception.

Especially check that the exception is taken with local and global interrupts disabled

Feature:
Data bus error shall cause a NMI.

Note that all sub features can be verified in a single test case
Feature Description: Bus error shall cause a jump to nmi_addr_i
Verification Goal: Verify correct execution address

Feature:
Data bus error shall cause a NMI.

Note that all sub features can be verified in a single test case
Feature Description: mepc CSR shall be written with the address of the next instruction to be executed when the NMI was taken
Verification Goal: Verify mepcvalue

Feature:
Data bus error shall cause a NMI.

Note that all sub features can be verified in a single test case
Feature Description: The mtval CSR shall be written with the faulting data address
Verification Goal: Verify mtval value

Feature:
Data bus error shall cause a NMI.

Note that all sub features can be verified in a single test case
Feature Description: mcause shall be set to the value given in the mcause table in the CV32E40X User Manual
Verification Goal: Verify mcause value

Feature: Data bus error on misaligned load/store
Feature Description: Any load or store instruction that has data associated with a faulting data bus fetch shall have an associated bus error
Verification Goal: Verify that misaligned load/stores gets the correct bus error status

Feature: A faulting load shall still write the register file
Feature Description: To limit fanout on timing critical signals, faulty data will be written to the register.
Verification Goal: Verify that bus-error related data is written to the register file

Feature: Instruction set simulators need to be notified and take in to account instruction bus errors, and predict how the core will react to the resulting precise exception. This capability will be necessary in order to fully verify instruction bus error operation on the core.
Feature Description: A faulty memory can cause non-stop data bus error. This will stop meaningful execution, but behaviour needs to be verified regardless
Verification Goal: Verify behaviour during continous instruction bus error

Feature:
The OBI agent will be required to randomly generate bus errors, and verify that the signals instr_err_i and data_err_i comply with the OBI Spec. 

In order to use randomization of bus errors without trigger errors with behaviour within spec when confronted with near-continous bus errors, the UVM agent will need to implement a minimum distance between bus errors. This should be controllable via parameter.

Verification Goal: Verify behaviour during continous instruction bus error

Therefore the scoreboard must be expanded to take these in to account, and verify that the interrupt appears within reasonable time, and are handled according to spec.
